messages.text:
Hi Everyone. I use `nvim` with the Julia LSP server (julials). Today, after not having been using it for a while, I noticed it stopped working. Changes I've made recently include:
• Updating `nvim`  (I have NVIM v0.5.0-dev+965-gd0668b36a installed).
• Removed the `diagnostic-nvim` plugin since it is deprecated and its features have been moved to nvim core. I followed this <https://github.com/nvim-lua/diagnostic-nvim/issues/73|migration guide> 
• Switched to Julia 1.5.3
This is the content of `lsp.log` :

elements.text: Hi Everyone. I use

Removed the
diagnostic-nvim
plugin since it is deprecated and its features have been moved to nvim core. I followed this
migration guide
Switched to Julia 1.5.3

messages.text:
Hail and well met fellow traveler! :crossed_swords: Welcome to <#CA8TYH0LU|vim> <@U01AJUF2GEP> - sit by the :fire: and chat a while :beers: .

Regarding Julia LSP, I used it with Neovim 5 and found it extremely buggy. Decided not to engage with it too much as the autocompletion was not great and found it slowed down my workflow. It has great potential, but not something I can invest in right now.

messages.text:
re-posting from zulip:

I have some admittedly idiosyncratic preferences for my indentations.  In particular, I want all closing delimiters to occur at the start of new lines,  unless they enclose function arguments.

So, for example, currently if I write a closing delimiter on a new line I get, e.g.
```julia
Dict(:a=>1,
     :b=>2,
    )```
What I *want* is
```julia
Dict(:a=>1,
     :b=>2,
)```
For functions, what I get is
```julia
function f(x=1;
        kwarg1=2
    )
end```
but what I *want* is
```julia
function f(x=1;
           kwarg1=2
          )
end```
Anyone know what I can set to achieve this?  I figure the first one is probably easy

messages.text:
<@UUS6GL8BH>
1. Regarding tmux + kak, its better to just install the kitty terminal... Heck, its the most awesome terminal I've ever used. Then you won't need tmux at all.
2. The momentum in kak, (as awesome as the software itself is) is kinda... slow or dead... I think it's because there're waaaay less people working on kak and kak-lsp. The fixes come in 2-4 years... which means we've to probably implement the stuff we want ourselves.
3. Listing the stuff - 1. A better implementation for the lsp-hover in kak-lsp and 2. Figuring if the problem in unicode auto-complete lies within kakoune or kak-lsp, and then fixing it.

elements.text: Regarding tmux + kak, its better to just install the kitty terminal... Heck, its the most awesome terminal I've ever used. Then you won't need tmux at all.

The momentum in kak, (as awesome as the software itself is) is kinda... slow or dead... I think it's because there're waaaay less people working on kak and kak-lsp. The fixes come in 2-4 years... which means we've to probably implement the stuff we want ourselves.
Listing the stuff - 1. A better implementation for the lsp-hover in kak-lsp and 2. Figuring if the problem in unicode auto-complete lies within kakoune or kak-lsp, and then fixing it.

messages.text: If the above problems are fixed, I think kakoune is good enough to deserve a mention in <http://julialang.org|julialang.org>:slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: If the above problems are fixed, I think kakoune is good enough to deserve a mention in
julialang.org

messages.text:
So... <@UUS6GL8BH> and other users of Kakoune

kakoune doesn't provide auto-indent for julia
The lsp just provides a format option, not auto-indent

I've submitted a PR to kakoune, to implement auto-indent features for julia, but before it gets merged and released.... <https://github.com/mawww/kakoune/pull/4051>
Feel free to copy and paste this to your julia.kak file (`/usr/share/kak/rc/filetype/julia.kak` in linux)
<https://raw.githubusercontent.com/clad26/kakoune/patch-1/rc/filetype/julia.kak>

elements.text: So...

and other users of Kakoune

kakoune doesn't provide auto-indent for julia
The lsp just provides a format option, not auto-indent

I've submitted a PR to kakoune, to implement auto-indent features for julia, but before it gets merged and released....
Feel free to copy and paste this to your julia.kak file (
/usr/share/kak/rc/filetype/julia.kak
in linux)

messages.text:
I'm saying this because it doesn't support vimL & can't use existing vim plugins directly? (unlike, e.g neovim) And I can't use Kakoune stuff in vim.

I don't care if it's also a "modal editor" and has "vim-like key binding" out of the box, it's not vim (compatible)

messages.text:
I still think an "IDE" channel is good, for having general discussion about different IDEs!:slightly_smiling_face:
For specific tooling in IDEs, I think this channels like these are better! Plus if someone has a new IDE to share, would be great for those too! I think all such guys will end up either on <#C9YGT3NG4|emacs> or <#CA8TYH0LU|vim> which will create the current situation again!
